Name: primary congenital glaucoma
Definition: A glaucoma that is characterized by damage to the optic nerves that reduces peripheral vision and leads to blindness

Name: open-angle glaucoma
Definition: A glaucoma characterized by optic nerve damage resulting in progressive loss of visual field and increased pressure in the eye due to trabecular blockage.

Name: hypersecretion glaucoma
Definition: An esophageal cancer that arises from transformed cells of mesenchymal origin sarcoma and located_in the esophagus.
Synonym: vascular lesions of cord complicating labor and delivery

Name: aqueous misdirection
Definition: An esophageal cancer that arises from transformed cells of mesenchymal origin sarcoma and located_in the esophagus.
Synonym: vascular lesions of cord complicating labor and delivery

Name: phacogenic glaucoma
Definition: A Chagas disease that involves deterioration of the function of the myocardium caused due to Trypanosoma cruzi infection

Name: traumatic glaucoma
Definition: An acquired immunodeficiency syndrome that results_in infection located_in brain

Name: obsolete moderate recurrent major depression
Definition: An acquired immunodeficiency syndrome that results_in infection located_in brain

Name: angle-closure glaucoma
Definition: A parathyroid gland disease characterized by an overactivity of the parathyroid glands
Synonym: primary open-angle glaucoma with narrow angles

Name: obsolete gonococcal peritonitis
Definition: A parathyroid gland disease characterized by an overactivity of the parathyroid glands
Synonym: primary open-angle glaucoma with narrow angles

Name: obsolete pharyngeal gonorrhea
Definition: A parathyroid gland disease characterized by an overactivity of the parathyroid glands

Name: obsolete gonococcal keratosis
Definition: A parathyroid gland disease characterized by an overactivity of the parathyroid glands

Name: obsolete gonococcal urethritis
Definition: A parathyroid gland disease characterized by an overactivity of the parathyroid glands

Name: obsolete lymphoma by site
Definition: A parathyroid gland disease characterized by an overactivity of the parathyroid glands

Name: neovascular glaucoma
Definition: An eye disease that is characterized by an unstable or a sustained increase in the intraocular pressure which the eye cannot withstand without damage to its structure or impairment of its function.

Name: borderline glaucoma
Definition: An eye disease that is characterized by elevated intraocular pressure in the absence of optic nerve damage or visual field loss.

Name: steroid-induced glaucoma
Definition: An acute inflammation of lacrimal passage that is characterized by inflammation of the lacrimal sac
